title: A’s and B’s Age are in ratio 4 : 5. 15 years hence the ratio will be 5 : 6 what is A’s present age? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let A’s age be x and B’s age be y. Then, x/y = 4/5 Therefore, 4y = 5x Therefore, y = 5x/4 15 years later, their ages will be x+15 and y+15 respectively. According to the given condition, x+15/y+15 = 5/6 Substituting y = 5x/4, we get x+15/(5x/4)+15 = 5/6 Therefore, x+15/{(5x+60)/4} = 5/6 Therefore, 4x+60/5x+60=5/6 Therefore, 24x+360 = 25x+300 Therefore, x = 60. A’s age is 60 years.
